conclusion: Analyze the circuit to determine voltage between points a and b when switch S is closed.
When switch S is open, the voltmeter reads 6V, indicating voltage across 20Ω resistor is 6V. The 10Ω resistor is not in the circuit.
When switch S is closed, 10Ω resistor is in parallel with 20Ω resistor.
Calculate equivalent resistance R_eq of parallel combination: R_eq = 6.67 Ω.
Total resistance R_total is the sum of R_eq and unknown resistance R.
Voltage across R_eq is the same as voltage across 20Ω resistor when switch is open, which is 6V.
Voltage between points a and b when switch S is closed is the voltage across the parallel combination, remaining 6V.
